lines.text:
[at Neddy Burton's funeral]
One thing from the bible she liked. "And Adam called his wife's name Eve, because she was the mother of all living." To me, Neddy, you were the mother of all living. You were life itself. God... just one thing... take care of this woman. Amen.

[Pacer, mortally wounded, visits his brother for the last time]
Don't come no closer. I just want to make sure you're all right. Don't try to help me, Clint. I've been killed already... Stubborn about dying.
Let me get the Doc!
Too late. Too late. The only thing to do now is to die.
Pacer, for God's sake.
You live for me, Clint. Maybe some day... somewhere people will understand... folks like us.
Oh, you'll be all right.
Unh-uh. When I was fighting off the other Kiowas... I saw the... flaming star of death. I gotta last long enough to go into the hills and die. I trust you not to follow me, Clint.

[Pacer rides off]
Pacer. Hey, Pacer!
[shouts]
Pacer!
Kiowa Pacer. Is it true, earth, round like ball, white man live on all sides?
That is true.
Tell me, why men on bottom not fall off?
I've never been there. Maybe they do.
[they all laugh]
If shooting starts I'll live long enough to kill you.
All Ma and me ever got from Whites is mean looks and don't get uppish with us.
Oh, that's not true.

You were the worst. You made me feel it the worst. When I was little I liked you a lot. You were the only girl I ever liked a whole lot. But ever since you've been old enough to know, you never looked at me once without saying something in the back of your head. "He's Kiowa. Clint's all right, but watch out for Pacer."

[as Pacer and Clint ride into town]
You heard what pa said. No horsing around with Ros.
Now, just a minute. What do you mean "horsing around"?
Well, ain't that what you're doing with her?
No, it ain't.
You mean, you mean it?
And what if I do?
With a gal that wears britches?
What's wrong with a gal that wears britches?
Well, ain't nothing wrong, but, uh, on second thought, you might look pretty good with skirts on.
[Clint laughs]

[as the Burtons and their guests finish dinner]
Whole supper was just great, Mrs. Burton. Of course, like Will and me always say, when it comes to cookin', no one would ever guess you was any different from... well, our ma or anybody else.
I'm really proud you liked it Tom. Just a little more cake?

[Tom chuckles]
No, ma'am!
If anybody follows us, they'll be pure hell to pay!
If you hurt that child, I'll get you, you godless savage!
Stay where you are, Pierce!
You heard Dred, Indian! Any harm comes to that girl and you're dead in a minute!
Just keep talkin', Ford and you'll be dead now!
